column4: check boot squence ? may be you booted the wrong drive if they are on .?
grub works fine when these 'extra' drives are not powered up
they don't have any essential OS files on them
when they are on, i don't even get an option to choose an OS, just an error "no such device" followed by a long string of letters and numbers
it is still possible to have grub install on the usb and you yet boot them in BIOS
